revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=April 2018}} {{Infobox person | name = Matt LeBlanc | image = X 217c5312.jpg | caption = LeBlanc in 2011 | birth_name = Matthew Steven LeBlanc | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1967|07|25|mf=y}} | birth_place = [[Newton, Massachusetts]], U.S. | occupation = [[Actor]], [[television host]], comedian | years_active = 1987–present | known_for = ''[[Friends]]
[[Episodes (TV series)|Episodes]]
[[Man with a Plan (TV series)|Man with a Plan]]
[[Joey (TV series)|Joey]]
[[Top Gear (2002 TV series)|Top Gear]]'' | spouse = {{marriage|Melissa McKnight|2003|2006|reason=divorced}} | partner = [[Andrea Anders]] (2006–2015)
Aurora Mulligan (2016–present) | children = 1{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cF45SRk-DCE |title=Matt LeBlanc Is Not Afraid To Live on the Wild Side |website=[[The Late Show with Stephen Colbert]] |date=October 22, 2016 |accessdate=August 22, 2017|via=YouTube}} }} '''Matthew Steven LeBlanc''' ({{IPAc-en|l|ə|ˈ|b|l|ɒ|ŋ|k}}; born July 25, 1967) is an American actor, comedian and [[Television presenter|television host]]. He received international recognition for his portrayal of dim-witted womaniser [[Joey Tribbiani]] on the [[NBC]] [[sitcom]] ''[[Friends]]'', which ran from 1994 to 2004. For his work on ''Friends'', LeBlanc received three [[Emmy Award]] nominations. LeBlanc has also starred as a fictionalized version of himself in the [[BBC]]/[[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]] comedy series ''[[Episodes (TV series)|Episodes]]'' (2011–2017), for which he won a [[Golden Globe Award]] and received four additional Emmy Award nominations. From 2016 to 2018, LeBlanc hosted the [[BBC]] series ''[[Top Gear (2002 TV series)|Top Gear]]''. He plays Adam Burns in the [[CBS]] sitcom ''[[Man with a Plan (TV series)|Man with a Plan]]'' since 2016. == Early life == LeBlanc was born in [[Newton, Massachusetts]]. His mother, Patricia (née Di Cillo), was an office manager, and his father, Paul LeBlanc, was a mechanic.{{cite web |url=http://www.filmreference.com/film/2/Matt-LeBlanc.html |title=Matt LeBlanc (1967– ) |website=FilmReference.com}}{{cite magazine |url=http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20140080,00.html |title=Way to Go, Joey! |first=Michelle |last=Tauber |date=May 19, 2003 |magazine=[[People (magazine)|People]]}}{{cite web|url=http://www.italoamericano.org/story/2015-10-16/mattleblanc |title=Matt LeBlanc takes his Italian origins to his heart |date=October 16, 2015 |website=Italo-Americano |accessdate=August 22, 2017}} His father is of [[French-Canadian]] descent and his mother is of [[Italian people|Italian]] ancestry.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/tvandradio/10833366/Matt-LeBlanc-I-have-an-ego-but-I-try-to-leave-it-at-the-door.html |title=Matt LeBlanc: 'I have an ego, but I try to leave it at the door' |newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |location=London |first=Stephanie |last=Rafanelli |date=May 17, 2014 |accessdate=January 7, 2015 |archivedate=January 7, 2015 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VPbWt79y?url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/tvandradio/10833366/Matt-LeBlanc-I-have-an-ego-but-I-try-to-leave-it-at-the-door.html |deadurl=no |df= }} He attended [[Newton North High School]], and graduated in 1985, alongside [[comedian]] [[Louis C.K.|Louis C.K]].{{cite news |title=Louis C.K. and Matt LeBlanc, way back when |url=https://www.bostonglobe.com/lifestyle/names/2015/09/19/emmy-nominees-louis-and-matt-leblanc-knew-them-when/K8mD1IpH0Fr5HtyZZvGe6L/story.html |first=Jill |last=Radsken |date=September 20, 2015 |newspaper=[[The Boston Globe]] |accessdate=March 28, 2016}}{{cite news| url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/matt-leblanc-i-was-getting-divorced-work-wasnt-a-priority-it-was-a-rough-time-cmql82nl8| title=Matt LeBlanc: ‘I was getting divorced, work wasn’t a priority — it was a rough time’ ’| last=Rose| first=Hilary|date=March 20, 2018| work=[[The Times]]| location=London| access-date=March 21, 2018| language=en| issn=0140-0460}} At the age of 17 LeBlanc moved to New York to pursue a career in [[Model (person)|modelling]]. == Career == ===1987–1994: Early career=== LeBlanc first appeared in a 1987 [[Heinz Tomato Ketchup]] commercial. In 1988, he starred in the television drama ''[[TV 101]]'' for one season. In 1991, he had a recurring role on the hit [[Fox (network)|Fox]] [[sitcom]], ''[[Married... with Children]]''. He played Vinnie Verducci, the son of one of the friends of the protagonist, [[Al Bundy]] and the boyfriend of Al's daughter, [[List of Married... with Children characters#Kelly Bundy|Kelly]]. He went on to star in two short-lived [[television spin-off|spin-offs]] of ''[[Married... with Children]]'', ''[[Top of the Heap]]'' in 1991 and ''[[Vinnie and Bobby]]'' in 1992. He appeared in two of [[Jon Bon Jovi]]'s [[music video]]s: "[[Miracle (Jon Bon Jovi song)|Miracle]]", from the ''[[Young Guns II]]'' soundtrack in 1990, and "[[Say It Isn't So (Bon Jovi song)|Say It Isn't So]]" in 2000.{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GRSB-QZHpXM |title=Bon Jovi – Say It Isn' So |work=YouTube |accessdate=May 22, 2011}} He also appeared in [[Alanis Morissette]]'s single "[[Walk Away (Alanis Morissette song)|Walk Away]]" in 1991, in the last seconds of [[Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers]] "[[Into the Great Wide Open (song)|Into the Great Wide Open]]" in which he is seen getting a tattoo, and in [[Bob Seger]]'s "[[Night Moves (song)|Night Moves]]" in 1994.{{cite web |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b01brd8t |title=Top Gear; Series 18, Episode 2 |website=[[BBC Two]] |accessdate=February 5, 2012}} ===1994–2004: Breakout role as Joey Tribbiani=== {{Main|Friends}} LeBlanc found success in the role of [[Joey Tribbiani]] on ''[[Friends]]'', and went on to play this character for 12 years — 10 seasons of ''Friends'' and two seasons of ''[[Joey (TV series)|Joey]]''. ''Friends'' was successful and LeBlanc, along with his co-stars, gained wide recognition among viewers. This ensemble situation comedy became a major hit for NBC, airing on Thursday nights for ten years.{{cite web| url=http://www.notablebiographies.com/newsmakers2/2005-La-Pr/LeBlanc-Matt.html| title=Matt LeBlanc Biography - life, family, children, parents, name, story, wife, school, mother - Newsmakers Cumulation| website=www.notablebiographies.com| language=en| access-date=December 1, 2017}} For his performance, LeBlanc received three [[Primetime Emmy Award]] nominations, three [[Golden Globe]] award nominations, and one [[Screen Actors Guild Award]]. During this time he also appeared in the films ''[[Lookin' Italian]]'' (1994), ''[[Ed (film)|Ed]]'' (1996), ''[[Lost in Space (film)|Lost in Space]]'' (1998), ''[[Charlie's Angels (2000 film)|Charlie's Angels]]'' (2000), and its sequel, ''[[Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle]]'' (2003). [[File:LeBlanc and Meryl at 69th Annual Golden Globes Awards.jpg|thumb|241x241px|LeBlanc at the 69th Annual Golden Globes Awards, with [[Meryl Streep]], on January 15, 2012.]] ===2006–2011: Hiatus=== Following the cancellation of ''[[Joey (TV series)|Joey]]'', LeBlanc announced that he would be taking a one-year hiatus from acting on TV, which later turned into five years. His next role would be as a fictionalized version of himself on ''[[Episodes (TV series)|Episodes]]''.{{cite magazine |title=Matt LeBlanc on Life after 'Friends' and Taking a Six Year Hiatus |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/video/matt-leblanc-life-friends-taking-712923 |date=June 27, 2014 |magazine=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |accessdate=March 30, 2016}} ===2011–present: ''Episodes'', ''Top Gear'' & ''Man with a Plan''=== In 2011, LeBlanc began appearing as a fictional version of himself in ''Episodes'', a [[BBC]]/[[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]] television series about a British television series that is remade for an American audience.{{cite news |first=James |last=Rampton |date=January 6, 2011 |title=Episodes: The one where Matt LeBlanc plays himself... |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/tv/features/episodes-the-one-where-matt-leblanc-plays-himself-2177012.html |newspaper=The Independent |location=London |accessdate=March 2, 2011}}{{cite web |date=January 4, 2011 |title=Matt LeBlanc Spoofs Himself On Comedy 'Episodes' |url=http://www.accesshollywood.com/matt-leblanc-pokes-fun-at-the-world-of-tv-friends-and-himself-on-showtimes-episodes_article_41726 |website=[[Access Hollywood]] |accessdate=March 2, 2011}} The series is written by ''Friends'' co-creator [[David Crane (producer)|David Crane]] and his partner [[Jeffrey Klarik]].{{cite web |last=Parks |first=Tim |date=September 30, 2009 |title=LeBlanc to star as himself on 'Episodes' |url= http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/ustv/a179903/leblanc-to-star-as-himself-on-episodes.html |website=[[Digital Spy]] |accessdate=September 30, 2009}} LeBlanc won the [[69th Golden Globe Awards|2012]] [[Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Television Series Musical or Comedy|Golden Globe for Best Actor in a TV Series Comedy]] for his performance, and was nominated for an additional four [[Primetime Emmy Awards]].{{cite web |url=http://www.goldenglobes.org/nominations/ |title=Nominations & Winners |website=Golden Globes |accessdate=January 16, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100108115828/http://www.goldenglobes.org/nominations/ |archivedate=January 8, 2010 |df= }} The final season of ''Episodes'', its fifth, began filming in 2016 and premiered in 2017.{{cite web |title='Episodes' Renewed for Nine Episode Season Five by Showtime |url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2015/06/10/episodes-renewed-for-nine-episode-season-5-by-showtime/415734/ |website=[[TV by the Numbers]] |date=June 10, 2015 |accessdate=June 10, 2015}} In February 2012, LeBlanc appeared in the second episode of the eighteenth series of ''[[Top Gear (2002 TV series)|Top Gear]]'', where he set the fastest time of 1:42.1 in the [[Kia Cee'd]], narrowly beating previous holder [[Rowan Atkinson]] by 0.1 seconds. He also appeared in the fourth episode of the nineteenth season, to race the New Kia Cee'd, and beat his previous time. In February 2016, the BBC announced LeBlanc was to be one of the new presenters of [[Top Gear (2002 TV series)|''Top Gear'']].{{cite web |title=Matt LeBlanc joins Top Gear! |url=http://www.topgear.com/car-news/top-gear-tv/matt-leblanc-joins-top-gear |website=Top Gear |accessdate=February 4, 2016}} In September 2016, LeBlanc signed a new two-year deal to continue hosting ''Top Gear''.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-37470962 |title=Top Gear: Matt LeBlanc signs two-series deal |date=September 26, 2016 |website=BBC News |accessdate=August 22, 2017}} It was confirmed on 31 May 2018 that LeBlanc had decided to leave ''Top Gear'' after 3 years on the show. Matt's last series will air in Autumn 2018. Matt said about leaving the show stating, "LeBlanc said that despite the show being "great fun", the "time commitment and extensive travel... takes me away from my family and friends more than I'm comfortable with." He added: "It's unfortunate, but for these reasons I will not be continuing my involvement with the show. I will forever be a ''Top Gear'' fan and I wish the team continued success. Thanks for a great drive." The twenty-sixth series will be the last with LeBlanc.{{cite news| title=Matt LeBlanc to leave Top Gear| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-44320696| date=31 May 2018| publisher=BBC News}} Since 2016, LeBlanc has starred in the [[CBS]] sitcom ''[[Man with a Plan (TV series)|Man with a Plan]]''.{{cite web |url=http://deadline.com/2016/06/cbs-fall-premiere-dates-2016-1201776569/ |title=CBS Sets Fall 2016 Premiere Dates, Slates JonBenet Ramsey Limited Series |last=Andreeva |first=Nellie |website=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |date=June 21, 2016 |accessdate=June 21, 2016}} == Personal life == LeBlanc married Melissa McKnight (b. 1964 or 65), an American model, in May 2003.{{cite magazine |last=Wulff |first=Jennifer |url=http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20157263,00.html |title=Matt Leblanc's Surprise Split |magazine=People |volume=65 |number=15 |date=April 17, 2006 |accessdate=November 3, 2010}} McKnight and LeBlanc had been introduced in 1997 by her friend Kelly Phillips, wife of actor [[Lou Diamond Phillips]], and LeBlanc proposed to her a year later. Their daughter Marina Pearl, born in 2004, began suffering seizures when she was eight months old. By the time she was two years old, however, the condition, thought to be a form of [[dysplasia]], had mostly subsided. He was also step-father to McKnight's two children from her first marriage, Tyler (b. 1991) and Jacqueline Esposito.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/celebritynews/12143835/New-Top-Gear-presenter-Matt-LeBlanc-on-his-daughter-his-marriage-breakdown-and-his-darkest-years.html |first=Patrick |last=Sawer |date=February 6, 2016 |title=New Top Gear presenter Matt LeBlanc on his daughter, his marriage breakdown and his darkest years |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |accessdate=August 22, 2017}} LeBlanc and McKnight separated on January 1, 2006. Later in March of that year, LeBlanc and McKnight filed for divorce, citing [[irreconcilable differences]]. The divorce became final on October 6, 2006.{{cite magazine |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,1180477,00.html |magazine=People |title=Matt LeBlanc's Other Woman |date=April 6, 2006 |accessdate=March 27, 2009}} After his divorce, LeBlanc began dating actress [[Andrea Anders]]. The two met while filming the short-lived sitcom ''[[Joey (TV series)|Joey]]''. A representative for the pair confirmed the couple had split in January 2015.{{cite magazine |url=http://www.people.com/article/matt-leblanc-andrea-anders-break-up-split |title=Matt LeBlanc and Andrea Anders Break Up |first=Lanford |last=Beard |magazine=People |date=January 7, 2015}} In March 2018, LeBlanc confirmed that he was dating Aurora Mulligan, a producer on ''Top Gear''. == Filmography == === Film === {| class="wikitable" !Year !Title !Role !Notes |- |1987 |''Doll Day Afternoon'' |GI Joe |Film debut
Short film |- |1990 |''[[Jon Bon Jovi|Jon Bon Jovi: Miracle]]'' |Friend | rowspan="2" |Music video/short video |- |1991 |''[[Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers|Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers: Into the Great Wide Open]]'' |Young Man |- | rowspan="2" |1993 |''Grey Knight'' |Terhue | |- |''[[Red Shoe Diaries|Red Shoe Diaries 3: Another Woman's Lipstick]]'' |Kyle |Segment: "Just Like That" |- |1994 |''[[Lookin' Italian]]'' |Anthony Manetti | |- |1996 |''[[Ed (film)|Ed]]'' |Jack 'Deuce Cooper' |Nominated – [[Golden Raspberry Award for Worst New Star]]
Nominated – [[Golden Raspberry Award for Worst Screen Combo|Golden Raspberry Award for Worst Screen Couple]] (shared with the Mechanical Monkey) |- |1997 |''[[Red Shoe Diaries|Red Shoe Diaries 7: Burning Up]]'' |Jed |Segment: "Kidnap" |- |1998 |''[[Lost in Space (film)|Lost in Space]]'' |Major Don West | |- | rowspan="2" |2000 |''[[Jon Bon Jovi|Bon Jovi: Say It Isn't So]]'' |Unknown |Music video/short video |- |''[[Charlie's Angels (2000 film)|Charlie's Angels]]'' |Jason Gibbs | |- |2001 |''[[All the Queen's Men]]'' |O'Rourke | |- |2003 |''[[Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle]]'' |Jason Gibbs | |- |2009 |''[[The Rembrandts|The Rembrandts: I'll Be There for You]]'' |Joey Tribianni |Music video/video short |- |2010 |''[[Jonah Hex (film)|Jonah Hex]]'' |{{n/a}} |Executive producer |- |2014 |''[[Lovesick (2014 film)|Lovesick]]'' |Charlie Darby | |} === Television === {| class="wikitable" !Year !Title !Role !Notes |- |1988–1989 |''[[TV 101]]'' |Chuck Bender |Television debut
Series regular; 13 episodes |- |1989 |''[[Just the Ten of Us]]'' |Todd Murphy |2 episodes |- | rowspan="2" |1990 |''[[Anything to Survive]]'' |Billy Burton |Television movie |- |''Monsters'' |Tommy |Episode: "Shave and a Haircut, Two Bites" |- | rowspan="2" |1991 |''[[Top of the Heap]]'' | rowspan="3" |Vinnie Verducci |Recurring role; 7 episodes |- |''[[Married... with Children|Married...with Children]]'' |3 episodes |- | rowspan="2" |1992–1993 |''[[Vinnie & Bobby]]'' |Series regular; 7 episodes |- |''[[Red Shoe Diaries]]'' |Tom's Brother, Jed Cody/Kyle |2 episodes |- |1993 |''[[Class of '96]]'' |Frank Goodman |Episode: "Bright Smoke, Cold Fire" |- | rowspan="2" |1994 |''[[Reform School Girl (1994 film)|Reform School Girl]]'' | rowspan="2" |Vince |Television movie |- |''[[Rebel Highway]]'' |Episode: "Reform School Girl" |- |1994–2004 |''[[Friends]]'' | rowspan="2" |[[Joey Tribbiani]] |Series regular; 236 episodes

[[People's Choice Awards|People's Choice Award for Favorite Actor in a New Television Series]] |} == References == {{Reflist|30em}} == External links == {{Commons category|Matt LeBlanc}} * {{IMDb name|1455}} * [http://www.emmys.com/celebrities/matt-leblanc Matt LeBlanc] at [[Emmys.com]] * [http://www.worldcat.org/search?qt=worldcat_org_all&q=matt+leblanc Matt LeBlanc] at [[WorldCat]] libraries * [http://www.rottentomatoes.com/celebrity/matt_leblanc/ Matt LeBlanc] at [[Rotten Tomatoes]] * [http://www.huffingtonpost.com/news/matt-leblanc/ Matt LeBlanc] at [[The Huffington Post|Huffington Post]] * [http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/matt-leblanc/165294 Matt LeBlanc] at [[TV Guide]] * {{twitter|Matt_LeBlanc}} {{Navboxes |title = Awards for Matt LeBlanc |list = {{Golden Globe Award Best Actor TV Comedy}} {{People's Choice Award for Favorite Actor in a New TV Series}} {{ScreenActorsGuildAwards EnsembleTVComedy 1994–1999}} }} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Leblanc, Matt}} [[Category:1967 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Actors from Newton, Massachusetts]] [[Category:American expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:American male comedians]] [[Category:American male film actors]] [[Category:American male television actors]] [[Category:American people of French-Canadian descent]] [[Category:American people of Italian descent]] [[Category:Best Musical or Comedy Actor Golden Globe (television) winners]] [[Category:Male actors from Massachusetts]] [[Category:Male actors of Italian descent]] [[Category:People from Hidden Hills, California]] [[Category:20th-century American male actors]] [[Category:21st-century American male actors]] [[Category:Top Gear people]] [[Category:Comedians from California]]
